src: Asegúrese de que su mano esté tan relajada como sea posible mientras sigue tocando las notas de forma correcta. Además, intente no realizar muchos movimientos raros con sus dedos. Así, se cansará lo menos posible. Tenga presente que, a diferencia del piano, no se necesita presionar demasiado fuerte las teclas para obtener un mayor volumen. Si usted desea elevar el volumen al tocar el acordeón, debe utilizar los fuelles con más presión o velocidad.
mt: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while you continue to play the notes correctly. Also, try not to make many strange movements with your fingers. This way, you will tire less. Keep in mind that, unlike the piano, you do not need to press the keys too hard to get a greater volume. If you want to raise the volume when playing the accordion, you must use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Uno de los problemas más comunes cuando se trata de convertir una película a DVD es la sobre exploración. El diseño de la mayoría de las televisiones tiene como objetivo complacer al público general. Es este el motivo por el que todas las imágenes que ve en la televisión aparecen con los bordes superior, inferior y laterales cortados. Esto se hace para garantizar que la imagen se despliegue en la pantalla completa. Esto se denomina sobreexploración. Lamentablemente, al crear un DVD, es muy probable que los bordes queden recortados y, si el vídeo tiene subtítulos cerca del margen inferior, no se verán enteros.
mt: One of the most common problems when converting a movie to DVD is over scanning. The design of most televisions is aimed at pleasing the general public. This is the reason why all the images you see on television appear with the top, bottom, and side edges cut off. This is done to ensure that the image is deployed on the full screen. This is called over scanning. Unfortunately, when creating a DVD, it is very likely that the edges will be cut off and if the video has subtitles near the bottom edge, they will not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: La base de la estrategia de EE. UU. fue el lanzamiento de ataques coordinados desde tres puntos diferentes. El general John Cadwalder iniciaría un ataque de distracción contra la tropa británica en Bordentown, con el fin de bloquear cualquier tipo de refuerzo. El general James Ewing evitó la fuga de las tropas antagónicas tomando el puente sobre Assunpink Creek y guiando a 700 soldados a través del río en Trenton Ferry. El ataque más importante, llevado a cabo por 2400 hombres, atravesaría el río nueve millas al norte de Trenton para luego dividirse en dos grupos, con el fin de lanzar un ataque antes de que saliera el sol: uno de ellos bajo el mando de Greene y, el otro, encabezado por Sullivan.
mt: The U.S. strategy was to launch coordinated attacks from three different points. General John Cadwalder would begin a diversionary attack against the British force in Bordentown, to block any reinforcement. General James Ewing would prevent the enemy's escape by taking the bridge over Assunpink Creek and leading 700 soldiers across the river at Trenton Ferry. The most important attack, carried out by 2400 men, would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton to split into two groups, to launch an attack before dawn: one under the command of Greene and the other led by Sullivan.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Luego de ser aprobada por el Congreso el 4 de julio, se envió un borrador escrito a mano y firmado por el presidente del Congreso, John Hancock, y el secretario, Charles Thomson, a la imprenta de John Dunlap, a unas pocas calles de distancia. Se realizaron, durante la noche, entre 150 y 200 copias, a las que actualmente se conoce como las «Copias Dunlap». Fue John Nixon quien leyó por primera vez el documento y lo hizo en el patio del Salón de la Independencia, el 8 de julio. El 6 de julio se envió una copia a George Washington, quien ordenó que se la leyeran a su ejército en Nueva York el 9 de julio. El 10 de agosto llegó otra copia a Londres. Las 25 fotografías de Dunlap, que se sabe que aún existen, son las copias más antiguas conservadas del documento. El manuscrito original se ha perdido.
mt: After being approved by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the president of Congress, John Hancock, and the secretary, Charles Thomson, was sent to the printing house of John Dunlap, a few blocks away. During the night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, which are now known as the "Dunlap Copies". John Nixon was the first to read the document, and he did so in the Independence Hall courtyard on July 8. On July 6, a copy was sent to George Washington, who ordered it to be read to his army in New York on July 9. On August 10, another copy arrived in London. The 25 Dunlap photographs, which are known to still exist, are the oldest copies of the document preserved. The original manuscript has been lost.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Al ver esta actividad, los colonizadores también habían solicitado refuerzos. Las tropas de refuerzo para las posiciones delanteras incluían al 1.er y al 3.er regimiento de New Hampshire, con 200 soldados, abajo el mando de los coroneles John Stark y James Reed, quienes luego ascendieron a generales. Los hombres de Stark se desplegaron a lo largo del vallado en el extremo norte de la ubicación de los colonos. Cuando la marea baja abrió una grieta junto al río Mystic a lo largo de la península noreste, velozmente prolongaron la extensión del cerco construyendo un muro bajo de piedra al norte que llegaba hasta las orillas de una pequeña playa. Gridley o Stark incrustaron una estaca a unos 100 pies (30 metros) por delante de la valla y dieron la orden de que nadie abriera fuego hasta que el ejército regular la sobrepasaran.
mt: When the colonists saw this activity, they also requested reinforcements. Reinforcements for the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd regiments of New Hampshire, with 200 men, under the command of Colonels John Stark and James Reed, who later rose to generals. Stark's men were deployed along the fence line at the northern end of the colonists' location. When the low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River at the northeastern peninsula, they quickly extended the encirclement by building a low stone wall northward that reached the shores of a small beach. Gridley or Stark drove a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered no one to fire until the regular army crossed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: La antigua China tenía una forma única de delimitar los diferentes períodos de tiempo. Cada etapa o cada familia en el poder constituía una dinastía distinta. Entre cada dinastía, existió también un período de inestabilidad, con provincias divididas. El más conocido fue el de los Tres Reinos, que se desarrolló a lo largo de 60 años, entre la dinastía Hhan y la Jin. Durante estas etapas, se desató una cruenta guerra entre muchos nobles que se disputaban el trono. Uno de los periodos más sanguinarios de la historia de Antigua China fue el de Los Tres Reinos, donde miles de personas murieron en una lucha por ocupar el trono del gran palacio en Xi'an.
mt: The ancient China had a unique way of defining different periods of time. Each stage or each family in power constituted a different dynasty. Between each dynasty, there was also a period of instability, with provinces divided. The most famous was the Three Kingdoms, which developed over 60 years, between the Han dynasty and the Jin. During these stages, a bloody war broke out between many nobles who were fighting for the throne. One of the most bloody periods in the history of Ancient China was the Three Kingdoms, where thousands of people died in a struggle to occupy the throne of the great palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Las colonias de hormigas guerreras también caminan y hacen nidos en diferentes fases. Durante la etapa nómada, las hormigas guerreas avanzan por la noche y, de día, se detienen para acampar. La colonia empieza una fase nómade cuando la comida disponible disminuye. En esta fase, forman nidos temporales que se cambian a diario. Cada uno de estos desmadres o marchas errantes dura aproximadamente 17 días.
mt: Warrior ant colonies also walk and build nests in different phases. During the nomadic stage, warrior ants march at night and stop during the day to camp. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food decreases. In this phase, they form temporary nests that are changed daily. Each of these nomadic or wandering camps lasts approximately 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Con frecuencia, muchos ritmos presentes en procesos fisiológicos y en el comportamiento dependen de manera decisiva de ciclos internos y su producción a través de relojes biológicos. Los ritmos periódicos, que no solo se tratan de reacciones a estímulos externos regulares, se han registrado en casi todos los seres vivos, incluso en bacterias, hongos, plantas y animales. Los relojes biológicos oscilan de forma autosostenida y tienen un período de funcionamiento cíclico libre, aun si no hay estímulos externos.
mt: Often, many rhythms present in physiological processes and behavior depend decisively on internal cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not just reactions to regular external stimuli, have been recorded in almost all living things, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks oscillate autonomously and have a free-running cyclic working period, even if there are no external stimuli.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Una población es la reunión de organismos de una misma especie en particular dentro una zona geográfica específica. Cuando los individuos miembros una población comparten algún rasgo fenotípico particular de forma idéntica, se los denomina monomórficos. Se llama polimórficos a quienes exhiben diversas variantes de un mismo rasgo.
mt: A population is the gathering of organisms of the same species in a particular geographical area. When the individuals of a population share some particular phenotypic feature in identical form, they are called monomorphic. Those who exhibit various variants of the same feature are called polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: El turismo basado en la naturaleza suele atraer a gente interesada en visitar áreas naturales para disfrutar del paisaje, lo que incluye la vida silvestre animal y vegetal. Algunos ejemplos de posibles actividades en el lugar son: caza, pesca, fotografía, avistamiento de aves y visita a parques, y estudio de información del ecosistema. Un ejemplo es visitar, tomar fotografías y aprender sobre los orangutanes en Borneo.
mt: Nature-based tourism usually attracts people interested in visiting natural areas to enjoy the landscape, which includes animal and plant wildlife. Some examples of possible activities on site are: hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching and visiting parks, and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, taking photographs and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Cada mañana, las personas abandonan pequeños pueblos en sus automóviles para ir hacia sus trabajos y suelen cruzarse con otras cuyos empleos se encuentran en el lugar del que acaban de salir. En esta lanzadera de traslado dinámico, todos están de algún modo conectados con un sistema de transporte basado en el uso de automóviles privados, y lo sostienen. Actualmente, los científicos sostienen que esta economía masiva del carbono ha privado a la biosfera de uno de sus estados regulares que ha contribuido con la evolución de la humanidad por los últimos dos millones de años.
mt: Every morning, people leave small towns in their cars to go to work and often cross paths with others whose jobs are in the place they just left. In this dynamic commute shuttle, everyone is somehow connected to a car-based transportation system, and it sustains them. Currently, scientists say this massive carbon economy has deprived the biosphere of one of its regular states that has contributed to human evolution for the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: El átomo puede ser considerado como una de las piedras angulares para la construcción toda la materia. Es una estructura muy compleja que está formada, conforme el modelo simplificado de Bohr, por un núcleo central en torno al que orbitan electrones; algo similar a los planetas que giran alrededor del Sol. Ver Figura 1.1. Son dos partículas las que componen el núcleo; estas son los protones y los neutrones. Mientras que los neutrones no tienen carga eléctrica, la de los protones es positiva y, la de los electrones, negativa.
mt: The atom can be considered as one of the building blocks for the construction of all matter. It is a very complex structure that is formed, according to the simplified Bohr model, by a central nucleus around which electrons orbit; something similar to the planets that revolve around the Sun. See Figure 1.1. Two particles make up the nucleus; these are protons and neutrons. While neutrons have no electric charge, the charge of protons is positive and that of electrons is negative.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Actualmente, casi todas las computadoras funcionan en base a la manipulación de datos codificados bajo el sistema binario. Un número binario únicamente puede tener uno de dos valores, ellos son el 0 y el 1 y, de acuerdo con la jerga informática, estos números se conocen como dígitos binarios, o bits.
mt: Currently, almost all computers operate on the manipulation of data encoded under the binary system. A binary number can only have one of two values, they are the 0 and the 1 and, according to the jargon of computing, these numbers are known as binary digits, or bits.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Los blogs también pueden contribuir a mejorar la redacción de los alumnos. Aun cuando los estudiantes suelen iniciar su experiencia de blog con una gramática y ortografía poco cuidadas, esto generalmente cambia ante la presencia de una audiencia. Debido a que los estudiantes suelen ser los lectores que más critican, el escritor de blogs empieza a esforzarse por mejorar su redacción, a fin de evitar las críticas. Asimismo, el blogueo «exige que los alumnos sean más comprensivos del mundo que los circunda». La necesidad de avivar el interés de la audiencia los inspira a ser inteligentes e interesantes (Toto, 2004). Los blogs son un recurso que inspira a la colaboración y animan a los alumnos a profundizar su aprendizaje más allá del típico día escolar. El uso adecuado de los blogs «puede empoderar a los alumnos para que sean más analíticos y críticos, a través de la respuesta activa a los contenidos de internet, pueden definir sus posturas en el contexto de los escritos de otros, además de establecer sus perspectivas sobre temas específicos» (Oravec, 2002).
mt: Blogs can also help improve students' writing. Although students often begin their blogging experience with poor grammar and spelling, this usually changes when they have an audience. Because students are often the most critical readers, the blogger begins to try to improve his or her writing in order to avoid criticism. In addition, blogging "requires students to be more sensitive to the world around them." The need to capture the interest of an audience inspires them to be intelligent and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogs are a resource that inspires collaboration and encourages students to go beyond the typical school day. The appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to be more analytical and critical, through active response to Internet content, they can define their positions in the context of others' writings, as well as establish their perspectives on specific topics" (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: La comunicación asincrónica fomenta el tomarse un tiempo para reflexionar y reaccionar frente a otros. Permite que los alumnos trabajen a su propio ritmo y controlen el de la información instructiva. Existen, además, menos limitaciones en cuanto al tiempo, posibilitando horarios laborales flexibles. (Bremer, 1998) El uso de Internet y de la red informática mundial permite que los estudiantes tengan acceso a la información en todo momento. Los alumnos también pueden enviar consultas a los instructores a cualquier hora del día y recibir una respuesta razonablemente ágil, en vez de aguardar hasta el siguiente encuentro en persona.
mt: Asynchronous communication encourages taking time to reflect and react to others. It allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. There are also fewer time limitations, allowing flexible work hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the worldwide computer network allows students to have access to information at any time. Students can also send questions to instructors at any time of day and receive a reasonably quick response, instead of waiting until the next in-person meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: El castillo típico medieval ha servido de inspiración durante largo tiempo a la imaginación y evoca imágenes de justas, banquetes y caballería artúrica. Aun parados en medio de ruinas milenarias, es sencillo evocar los sonidos y los olores de enfrentamientos que ocurrieron hace mucho tiempo; casi escuchar el impacto de los cascos en los adoquines y sentir el olor del miedo que emergía desde las mazmorras. Pero, ¿nuestra imaginación tiene anclaje en la realidad? ¿Cuál fue el motivo, para comenzar, por el que se construyeron castillos? ¿Qué método se empleó para diseñarlos y construirlos?
mt: The typical medieval castle has long served as inspiration for the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, feasts and Arthurian knights. Even standing amid the ruins of millennia, it is easy to evoke the sounds and smells of battles long past; almost to hear the clatter of armor on cobblestones and smell the fear that emanated from the dungeons. But does our imagination have any grounding in reality? What was the original purpose for building castles? What methods were used to design and build them?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: El llamado castillo de Kirby Muxloe no es tal cosa, sino, antes bien, una casa fortificada, algo típico de esa época. Sus grandes ventanas de cristal y sus delgados muros no podrían haber resistido un ataque decidido por demasiado tiempo. En la década de 1480, cuando Lord Hastings inició su edificación, el país era bastante pacífico y solo se necesitaba defensa contra grupos de delincuentes errantes de poca monta.
mt: Kirby Muxloe's so-called castle is not a castle at all, but rather a fortified house, typical of the time. Its large glass windows and thin walls would not have been able to withstand a determined attack for very long. In the 1480s, when Lord Hastings began its construction, the country was relatively peaceful and only needed defense against petty wandering criminals.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Al producirse el cambio de la carrera de un cuarto a media milla, la velocidad pierde en gran medida su importancia, mientras que la resistencia se torna absolutamente necesaria. Desde ya, un corredor de la media milla de primera categoría, que puede superar los dos minutos, debe tener un buen nivel de velocidad, pero debe cultivar la resistencia a toda costa. La forma de prepararse para la temporada de carreras es la combinación de algo de carrera a campo traviesa durante la época invernal con un entrenamiento del tren superior del cuerpo en el gimnasio.
mt: When the race changes from a quarter to a half mile, speed loses much of its importance, while endurance becomes absolutely necessary. Of course, a first-class half-miler who can run under two minutes must have a good level of speed, but he must cultivate endurance at all costs. The way to prepare for the racing season is a combination of some cross-country running in the winter with upper-body training in the gym.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: No es posible que las prácticas nutricionales adecuadas, por sí solas, generen un rendimiento de elite, pero puede influir en gran medida el bienestar general de los atletas jóvenes. Tener un adecuado equilibrio energético, adoptar hábitos de hidratación eficaces y tomar conocimiento de los diferentes aspectos de las prácticas de suplementación puede contribuir a que los atletas incrementen su rendimiento y disfruten más del deporte.
mt: It is not possible for appropriate nutritional practices, by themselves, to generate elite performance, but they can greatly influence the overall well-being of young athletes. Having an adequate energy balance, adopting effective hydration habits and taking knowledge of the different aspects of supplementation practices can contribute to athletes increasing their performance and enjoying sport more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: La carrera de distancia media es un deporte relativamente económico; no obstante, existen muchos conceptos erróneos en relación con los pocos equipamientos requeridos para participar. Existen artículos que se pueden adquirir si se los estima necesarios; no obstante, la mayoría de ellos no tendrá impacto verdadero alguno en el rendimiento, o su incidencia será mínima. Los atletas pueden sentir que prefieren un producto, aun cuando no le proporcione beneficios verdaderos.
mt: The middle-distance race is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions about the few equipment required to participate. There are articles that can be purchased if they are deemed necessary; however, most of them will not have any real impact on performance, or its incidence will be minimal. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product, even though it does not provide real benefits.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: La IRM se basa en un fenómeno físico denominado resonancia magnética nuclear (RMN), cuyo descubrimiento tuvo lugar en la década de 1930, de la mano de Felix Bloch (que trabajaba para la Universidad de Stanford) y Edward Purcell (de la Universidad de Harvard). Durante esta resonancia, el campo magnético y las ondas de radio causan la emisión, por parte de los átomos, de minúsculas señales de radio. Fue un médico e investigador científico llamado Raymond Damadian quien, en el año 1970, descubrió las bases para la utilización de la resonancia magnética por imágenes como instrumento para elaborar diagnósticos médicos. Después de cuatro años se le otorgó una patente, la primera que se emitía a nivel mundial relacionada con la resonancia magnética. En 1997, el Dr. Damadian terminó de construir el primer escáner de resonancia magnética de «cuerpo entero», al que nombró el «Indomable».
mt: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), whose discovery took place in the 1930s, at the hands of Felix Bloch (who worked for Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (of Harvard University). During this resonance, the magnetic field and radio waves cause the emission, by atoms, of tiny radio signals. It was a doctor and scientific researcher called Raymond Damadian who, in 1970, discovered the basis for the use of magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic instrument. After four years, he was granted a patent, the first worldwide related to magnetic resonance. In 1997, Dr. Damadian finished building the first whole-body MRI scanner, which he named the "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Los seres humanos son, por mucho, la especie con más talento para leer la mente de otros. Ello implica que tenemos la capacidad de hacer predicciones acertadas respecto de las percepciones de otras personas, lo que se proponen, sus creencias, conocimientos y deseos. Entre estas capacidades, entender la intención de los demás es crucial, ya que nos permite resolver posibles ambigüedades en las acciones físicas. Por ejemplo, si usted viera a alguien romper la ventanilla de un automóvil, probablemente asumiría que intenta robar el vehículo de un tercero. Debería juzgárselo de forma diferente si hubiera extraviado las llaves de su propio automóvil y fuera este al que intentaba ingresar.
mt: Humans are, by far, the species with the most talent for reading minds. This implies that we have the ability to make accurate predictions about the perceptions of others, what they propose, their beliefs, knowledge and desires. Among these abilities, understanding the intentions of others is crucial, as it allows us to resolve possible ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone break the window of a car, you would probably assume that they were trying to steal the vehicle from a third party. You should judge them differently if they had lost the keys to their own car and were the one they were trying to enter.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Si bien se asocia mucho la inteligencia artificial con la ciencia ficción, es una especialidad de gran relevancia dentro de la informática, que se encarga del comportamiento, el aprendizaje y la adaptación inteligente en una máquina. La investigación en el campo de la IA supone el desarrollo de máquinas a fin de automatizar tareas que requieren un comportamiento inteligente. Ejemplos de ello son, entre otros, el monitoreo, planificación y programación, la capacidad para responder diagnósticos y consultas de los clientes, así como el reconocimiento facial, de escritura, de voz. Estas cuestiones se han vuelto disciplinas separadas, enfocadas en ofrecer soluciones a problemas de la vida real. El sistema de Inteligencia Artificial se utiliza ahora a menudo en los sectores de la economía, la medicina, la ingeniería y la milicia, del mismo modo en que fue incorporado en diversas aplicaciones de software de videojuegos y computadoras personales.
mt: While artificial intelligence is often associated with science fiction, it is a field of great importance within computer science, which deals with the behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in the field of AI involves the development of machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples of this are, among others, monitoring, planning and programming, the ability to respond to diagnostic and customer inquiries, as well as facial recognition, handwriting, and voice recognition. These issues have become separate disciplines, focused on offering solutions to real-life problems. The AI system is now often used in the economy, medicine, engineering and military sectors, as well as in various software applications for video games and personal computers.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Si bien se asocia mucho la inteligencia artificial con la ciencia ficción, es una especialidad de gran relevancia dentro de la informática, que se encarga del comportamiento, el aprendizaje y la adaptación inteligente en una máquina. La investigación en el campo de la IA supone el desarrollo de máquinas a fin de automatizar tareas que requieren un comportamiento inteligente. Ejemplos de ello son, entre otros, el monitoreo, planificación y programación, la capacidad para responder diagnósticos y consultas de los clientes, así como el reconocimiento facial, de escritura, de voz. Estas cuestiones se han vuelto disciplinas separadas, enfocadas en ofrecer soluciones a problemas de la vida real. El sistema de Inteligencia Artificial se utiliza ahora a menudo en los sectores de la economía, la medicina, la ingeniería y la milicia, del mismo modo en que fue incorporado en diversas aplicaciones de software de videojuegos y computadoras personales.
mt: While artificial intelligence is often associated with science fiction, it is a field of great importance within computer science, which deals with the behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in the field of AI involves the development of machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples of this are, among others, monitoring, planning and programming, the ability to respond to diagnostic and customer inquiries, as well as facial recognition, handwriting, and voice recognition. These issues have become separate disciplines, focused on offering solutions to real-life problems. The AI system is now often used in the economy, medicine, engineering and military sectors, as well as in various software applications for video games and personal computers.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Los patrones de pensamiento convergente son métodos para resolver problemas que relacionan distintas ideas o campos, en busca de una solución. El aspecto central de esta forma de pensar es la rapidez, la lógica y la precisión, así como la identificación de cuestiones fácticas a través de la reutilización de técnicas existentes y de la recolección de datos. Esta clase de pensamiento tiene como premisa principal la existencia de solo una respuesta correcta. Se piensa en términos de dos respuestas posibles, una correcta y otra incorrecta. Este tipo de pensamiento se relaciona con ciertas ciencias o procedimientos estandarizados. Quienes piensan de este modo, tienen un pensamiento lógico, pueden recordar patrones, resolver problemas y trabajar en pruebas científicas.
mt: Convergent thinking is a method of problem solving that relates different ideas or fields, in search of a solution. The central aspect of this form of thinking is speed, logic and precision, as well as the identification of factual issues through the re-use of existing techniques and data collection. This type of thinking has as its main premise the existence of only one correct answer. It is thought in terms of two possible answers, one correct and one incorrect. This type of thinking is related to certain sciences or standardized procedures. Those who think this way have logical thinking, can remember patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: A través de la grabación de videos, se han producido importantes hallazgos en la interpretación de micorexpresiones, que son movimientos en el rostro de tan solo unos milisegundos de duración. Concretamente, se sostiene que, mediante la adecuada lectura de sus microexpresiones, es posible detectar si una persona está mintiendo. Oliver Sacks, en su artículo El discurso del presidente, explicó la forma en que aquellos que no pueden comprender el habla a causa de un daño cerebral, pueden, no obstante, evaluar la sinceridad con precisión. Incluso sugiere que las habilidades para interpretar la conducta humana se pueden compartir con animales, como los perros domésticos.
mt: Through video recordings, important findings have been made in the interpretation of microexpressions, which are facial movements of only a few milliseconds in duration. Specifically, it is claimed that, through the proper reading of their microexpressions, it is possible to detect if a person is lying. Oliver Sacks, in his article The President's Speech, explained how those who cannot understand speech due to brain damage can, nevertheless, evaluate sincerity with precision. He even suggests that the ability to interpret human behavior can be shared with animals, such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: A medida que la capacidad de adquirir conocimientos y de aprender variaba del modo ya referido, la tasa base de obtención de conocimientos también se modificaba. El abordaje para adquirir conocimiento cambió. La presión ya no apuntaba al recuerdo individual, sino que la capacidad de recordar el texto pasó a ser el foco. Básicamente, el Renacimiento significó un cambio de contundente en la perspectiva del aprendizaje y la transmisión del conocimiento.
mt: As the capacity to acquire knowledge and to learn varied in the manner already referred to, the base rate of knowledge acquisition also changed. The approach to acquiring knowledge changed. The pressure was no longer aimed at individual recall, but the capacity to remember the text became the focus. Basically, the Renaissance meant a change of considerable magnitude in the perspective of learning and the transmission of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internet une y mezcla componentes propios de la comunicación masiva y entre personas. Los distintos rasgos que presenta la Internet abren paso a nuevas dimensiones desde la perspectiva del concepto de usos y recompensas. Por ejemplo, se señalan el «aprendizaje» y la «socialización» como incentivos significativos para el uso de Internet (James et al., 1995). Durante un estudio de las reacciones de los usuarios a los sitios web conducido por Eighmey y McCord (1998), se detectaron también la «participación personal» y las «relaciones duraderas» como nuevos factores motivacionales.
mt: Internet unites and mixes components of mass communication and interpersonal communication. The different features of the Internet open new dimensions from the perspective of the concept of uses and gratifications. For example, learning and socialization are mentioned as significant incentives for the use of the Internet (James et al., 1995). During a study of the reactions of users to websites conducted by Eighmey and McCord (1998), personal participation and lasting relationships were also detected as new motivational factors.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: La cúspide del estilo gótico tuvo lugar en el período entre los siglos X-XI y el XIV. En un comienzo, la forma de vestir recibió gran influencia de la cultura bizantina en el este. No obstante, debido a la lentitud de los canales de comunicación, los estilos occidentales podrían llevar un retraso de unos 25 a 30 años. Hacia fines de la Edad Media, Europa occidental empezó a desarrollar un estilo propio. Uno de los avances más significativos de esa época fue que, producto de las Cruzadas, las personas comenzaron a usar botones para abrochar sus prendas.
mt: The pinnacle of Gothic style took place between the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th. At first, the style of dress received great influence from Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slowness of communication channels, Western styles could be delayed by 25 to 30 years. By the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the most significant advances of that time was that, as a result of the Crusades, people began to use buttons to fasten their clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Podemos comenzar a llevar una vida más amigable con el planeta, formar parte de movimientos ambientalistas o, incluso, podemos volvernos activistas y luchar para aminorar, en alguna medida, el sufrimiento futuro. Es, en muchos casos, como el tratamiento asintomático. Pero si no se busca solamente una situación temporal, deberíamos encontrar la raíz de los problemas e intentar desactivarlos. Resulta manifiesto que el mundo ha sufrido grandes cambios, producto de los avances tecnológicos y científicos de la humanidad, y los problemas se han intensificado por causa de la superpoblación y el estilo de vida extravagante de las personas.
mt: We can start living a more environmentally friendly life, join environmental movements, or even become activists and fight to mitigate, to some extent, future suffering. It is, in many cases, like treating a symptom. But if we are not just looking for a temporary situation, we should find the root of the problems and try to deactivate them. It is obvious that the world has suffered great changes, due to the technological and scientific advances of humanity, and the problems have intensified due to overpopulation and the extravagant lifestyle of people.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: El equilibrio de poder era un sistema a través del cual los países europeos procuraban que se mantuviera la soberanía nacional de cada uno de los estados de ese continente. Los gobiernos nacionales solían cambiaban sus alianzas con el fin de mantener el equilibrio, ya que compartían el concepto de que todas las naciones europeas debían procurar impedir que solo una nación se hiciera poderosa. La Guerra de Sucesión de España fue la primera cuyo objeto principal fue el equilibrio de poder. Esto delimitó un cambio de gran importancia, dado que las potencias europeas no podrían recurrir a la excusa de que se trataba de enfrentamientos de índole religioso. Por ello, la guerra de los Treinta años sería la última en catalogarse como guerra religiosa.
mt: The balance of power was a system through which European countries sought to maintain the national sovereignty of each of the states of that continent. National governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance, as they shared the concept that all European nations should seek to prevent any one nation from becoming too powerful. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first whose main object was the balance of power. This delimited a change of great importance, since European powers could no longer use the excuse that it was a matter of religious confrontation. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last to be classified as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Durante esta fase de la historia de Europa, la iglesia católica, que había acumulado riqueza y poder, fue cuestionada. Por más de un milenio, el cristianismo había logrado unir a los estados europeos no obstante sus diferentes lenguas y costumbres. Su poder, presente por doquier, afectó a todos, desde el monarca hasta la plebe. Uno de los principios más importantes del cristianismo es que la riqueza debe utilizarse para aliviar el sufrimiento y la pobreza, y que los fondos de la iglesia se reservan para esa función específica. La cúpula central de la iglesia había permanecido en Roma por más de un milenio y esta concentración de poder y dinero hizo que muchos se preguntaran si este principio se estaba respetando.
mt: During this phase of European history, the Catholic Church, which had accumulated wealth and power, was questioned. For more than a millennium, Christianity had managed to unite the European states in spite of their different languages and customs. Its presence everywhere affected everyone, from the monarch to the commoner. One of the most important principles of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that the Church's funds are reserved for that specific purpose. The central dome of the Church had remained in Rome for more than a millennium and this concentration of power and money made many wonder if this principle was being respected.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: El 6 de octubre de 1789, una muchedumbre de mujeres del mercado obligó al aterrorizado monarca Luis XVI, a María Antonieta, sus dos hijos pequeños (María Teresa, de once años y Luis Carlos, de cuatro) y a la hermana del rey, Madam Elizabeth, a volver a París desde Versalles. Viajaron de vuelta hacia París en un carruaje rodeados por una muchedumbre que gritaban y lanzaban amenazas contra el rey y la reina. La muchedumbre forzó al rey y la reina a abrir por completo las ventanas de su carruaje. En cierto momento, un participante de la revuelta sacudió la cabeza de un guardia real ejecutado en Versalles frente a la reina, que estaba en pánico.
mt: 6 October 1789, a mob of market women forced the terrified King Louis XVI, Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Thérèse, eleven, and Louis Charles, four) and the king's sister, Madame Élisabeth, back to Paris from Versailles. They returned to Paris in a carriage surrounded by a mob who were shouting and threatening the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to open all the windows of their carriage. At one point, a participant in the revolt shook the head of a royal guard executed at Versailles in front of the queen, who was in a panic.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Al poco tiempo de desatarse las hostilidades, los británicos comenzaron un bloqueo naval a Alemania. Si bien la estrategia, que involucró la interrupción de suministros militares y civiles vitales, fue exitosa, dicha medida violó el derecho internacional generalizadamente reconocido y contemplado en varios acuerdos internacionales de los dos últimos siglos. Gran Bretaña extrajo aguas internacionales en sectores completos del océano para bloquear el ingreso de los barcos, poniendo en riesgo, incluso, a embarcaciones neutrales. Al haber recibido una respuesta reducida contra esta táctica, Alemania pensaba encontrarse con una reacción similar frente a su guerra submarina irrestricta.
mt: Shortly after hostilities began, the British began a naval blockade of Germany. While the strategy, which involved the interruption of vital military and civilian supplies, was successful, this measure violated the general international law and was contemplated in several international agreements of the last two centuries. Britain extracted international waters in complete sectors of the ocean to block the entry of ships, putting even neutral vessels at risk. Having received a reduced response to this tactic, Germany thought it would find a similar reaction to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Los casos registrados de esclerosis múltiple (EM) en EE. UU. ascienden a cerca de 400 000, lo que la hace la enfermedad neurológica más frecuente entre adultos jóvenes y de mediana edad. El sistema nervioso central, unión del cerebro, la médula espinal y el nervio óptico, es el objeto de ataque de la esclerosis múltiple. Los estudios indicaron que las mujeres tienen el doble de probabilidades que los hombres de padecer EM.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) have been recorded in the United States, making it the most common neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. The central nervous system, the union of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve, is the target of MS attack. Studies indicate that women have twice the chances of men of suffering MS.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: El estudio determinó que la depresión, el miedo y la sobredimensión intervinieron en la dinámica entre el dolor y la discapacidad en los pacientes con dolencias en la región lumbar. Solo los efectos de la catastrofización, no de la depresión o del miedo, estaban condicionados a sesiones de AF estructuradas, semanales y regulares. Los que participaban en actividades regulares demandaban mayor apoyo en cuanto a percepción negativa del dolor, marcando las distinciones entre el dolor crónico y la sensación de malestar presente en el movimiento físico habitual.
mt: The study determined that depression, fear and catastrophizing intervened in the dynamics between pain and disability in patients with low back pain. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression or fear, were conditioned by structured, weekly and regular AF sessions. Those who participated in regular activities demanded greater support in terms of negative perception of pain, marking the distinctions between chronic pain and the feeling of discomfort present in physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: La esgrima, deporte moderno, se practica a niveles muy variados, desde estudiantes que ejercitan en la universidad hasta olimpiadas y competiciones profesionales. La forma principal de practicar este deporte es a través duelos, en los que dos esgrimistas se enfrentan.
mt: Fencing, a modern sport, is practiced at many levels, from students exercising at university to Olympics and professional competitions. The main way to practice this sport is through duels, in which two fencers face each other.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: El envenenamiento interno puede no evidenciarse de inmediato. Sus síntomas, como, por ejemplo, el vómito, son demasiado habituales como para poder dar un diagnóstico inmediato. El más claro indicador de envenenamiento interno puede ser encontrar con un frasco abierto de medicinas o de productos de limpieza químicos tóxicos. Lea la etiqueta para contar con información específica sobre los primeros auxilios pertinentes para ese veneno específico.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately evident. Its symptoms, such as vomiting, are too common to immediately diagnose. The most obvious indicator of internal poisoning may be finding an open bottle of medicine or toxic cleaning products. Read the label for specific first aid information for that specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Para examinar a la víctima, usted primero debe inspeccionar la escena a efectos de garantizar su propia seguridad. Debe observar la posición en la que se encuentra la víctima al ir acercándose a él o ella, así como cualquier señal de alerta automática. Si al intentar prestar ayuda resulta herido, es posible que solo empeore las cosas.
mt: To examine the victim, you first must inspect the scene to ensure your own safety. You must observe the victim's position as you approach, as well as any warning devices. If you attempt to help and are injured, you may only make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

Si al intentar prestar ayuda resulta herido, es posible que solo empeore las cosas.

src: Son muchas sus consecuencias políticas y sociales, tales como el uso del sistema métrico, el desplazamiento del absolutismo hacia el republicanismo, el nacionalismo y la convicción de que el país pertenece al pueblo, y no a un solo soberano. Asimismo, luego de la Revolución, los puestos estuvieron abiertos a todos los candidatos masculinos, lo que permitió el éxito de los más ambiciosos y prestigiosos. Lo mismo sucede con los militares, ya que, en lugar de basar los cargos del ejército en clases, ahora se basan en el calibre. La Revolución Francesa fue también fuente de inspiración para que muchas otras personas de la clase obrera reprimida de otros países encarasen sus propias revoluciones.
mt: Its political and social consequences are many, such as the adoption of the metric system, the shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism, and the conviction that the country belongs to the people, not to a single sovereign.  Also, after the Revolution, positions were open to all male candidates, allowing the most ambitious and prestigious to succeed.  The same is true of the military, as positions are now based on caliber, rather than class.  The French Revolution was also a source of inspiration for many other repressed working classes in other countries to face their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Todos forman parte de la sociedad y hacen uso de los sistemas de transporte; y casi todos se quejan de ellos. En países desarrollados, es poco frecuente escuchar niveles parecidos de reclamos sobre la calidad del agua o el derrumbe de puentes. ¿Cuál es la razón de que los sistemas de transporte den lugar a quejas de tal calibre y por qué se producen fallas diariamente? ¿Son los ingenieros de transporte sencillamente incapaces? ¿O hay algo más sustancial que está sucediendo?
mt: All are part of society and use the transportation systems; and almost all complain about them. In developed countries, it is rare to hear similar levels of complaints about the quality of water or the collapse of bridges. What is the reason that transportation systems give rise to such complaints and why do failures occur daily? Are transportation engineers simply incapable? Or is something more substantial happening?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: El flujo de tráfico es el estudio del movimiento individual de conductores y vehículos entre dos puntos y de las interacciones entre ellos. Lamentablemente, no es tarea sencilla estudiar el flujo del tráfico, ya que es no es posible hacer predicciones exactas sobre el comportamiento de los conductores. Por fortuna, existe una tendencia en los conductores a mantener un comportamiento relativamente consistente, lo que permite que los flujos de tráfico tengan una consistencia lógica y puedan ser objeto de representación matemática aproximada. Con el fin de graficar más claramente el flujo de circulación, se establecieron relaciones entre los tres elementos más importantes: (1) flujo, (2) densidad y (3) velocidad. Dichas relaciones facilitan tanto el planeamiento y el diseño como las operaciones de los dispositivos viales.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the individual movement of drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions between them. Unfortunately, it is not an easy task to study traffic flow, since it is not possible to make exact predictions about the behavior of drivers. Fortunately, there is a tendency in drivers to maintain a relatively consistent behavior, which allows traffic flows to have a logical consistency and can be subject to approximate mathematical representation. In order to graphically clarify the flow of circulation, relationships were established between the three most important elements: (1) flow, (2) density and (3) speed. These relationships facilitate both planning and design as well as the operation of road devices.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Uno de los indicadores clave de que el ADN consistía en un material de tipo genético fue el experimento conducido por Hershey y Chase. Hershey y Chase insertaron su propio ADN en una bacteria usando fagos, o virus. Realizaron dos experimentos en los que marcaron el ADN del fago con fósforo radioactivo o la proteína del ADN con azufre radioactivo.
mt: One of the key indicators that DNA was a genetic material was the experiment conducted by Hershey and Chase. Hershey and Chase inserted their own DNA into a bacterium using phages, or viruses. They performed two experiments in which they labeled the DNA of the phage with radioactive phosphorus or the DNA protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: En función del tipo de mutación, de la significancia del trozo de material genético afectado y de si involucra células germinales, la mutación puede tener diversos efectos. Únicamente las mutaciones en células germinales se pueden transmitir a los niños, mientras que las que ocurren en otras partes pueden causar la muerte celular o cáncer.
mt: Depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the affected piece of genetic material, and whether it involves germ cells, the mutation can have various effects. Only mutations in germ cells can be passed on to children, while those that occur in other parts can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Al parecer, las cabras fueron domesticadas, por primera vez, hace unos 10 000 años, en los montes Zagros, en Irán. Con el propósito de obtener fácilmente su leche, pelo, carne y cuero, los pueblos y tribus antiguos empezaron a quedarse con ellos. Por lo general, las cabras domésticas eran reunidas en rebaños que vagaban por las colinas u otras zonas de pastoreo, con frecuencia cuidadas por pastores de cabras que solían ser niños o adolescentes, semejante al pastor más popular. Estos métodos de pastoreo aún se utilizan en la actualidad.
mt: It appears that goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. In order to easily obtain their milk, hair, meat and skin, ancient peoples began to keep them. Goats were usually gathered into herds that roamed the hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goat herders who were usually children or adolescents, similar to the most popular shepherd. These grazing methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: El golf es un deporte en el que sus participantes intentan introducir pelotas en hoyos, golpeándolas con un palo. Se disputan dieciocho hoyos durante una ronda regular y, por lo general, los jugadores comienzan por el primero del campo y terminan en el decimoctavo. Gana el jugador que alcanza la menor cantidad de golpes, o golpes de palo, para terminar el recorrido. El partido se juega sobre césped, y la hierba que rodea el hoyo se corta más y se denomina green.
mt: Golf is a sport in which its participants attempt to introduce balls into holes, hitting them with a club. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round and, generally, players start at the first hole of the course and end at the eighteenth. The player who achieves the lowest number of club strokes to finish the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass surrounding the hole is cut shorter and is called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: El objetivo capital de la ciencia es descifrar el modo en que funciona el mundo a través del método científico. En efecto, este método sirve de guía para la mayor parte de las investigaciones científicas. No se trata, sin embargo, de una experimentación, es una prueba que se usa para descartar una o más de las posibles hipótesis, haciendo preguntas y observaciones que guían la investigación científica.
mt: The ultimate goal of science is to decipher how the world works through the scientific method. In fact, this method serves as a guide for most scientific research. It is not, however, an experiment, it is a test used to rule out one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions and observations that guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Si bien las superficies que azotan los tornados son pequeñas, comparadas con otras tormentas agresivas, pueden destruir todo en su camino. Los tornados desarraigan árboles, arrancan paneles de los edificios y lanzan vehículos al cielo. El 2 % más agresivo de los tornados dura más de tres horas. Estas colosales tormentas traen ráfagas de hasta 480 km/h (133m/s; 300 mph).
mt: While the areas that tornadoes strike are small compared to other violent storms, they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, tear off building panels and throw vehicles into the air. The most violent 2% of tornadoes last more than three hours. These colossal storms bring winds of up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Por milenios y milenios las personas han fabricado y utilizando lentes de aumento. Sin embargo, los primeros verdaderos telescopios se desarrollaron en Europa, a fines del siglo XVI. Estos telescopios empleaban una combinación de dos lentes para que los objetos lejanos parecieran estar más cercanos y tener mayor tamaño.
mt: For millennia and millennia people have made and used magnifying lenses. However, the first true telescopes were developed in Europe, at the end of the sixteenth century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses so that distant objects appeared closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
